resources.string: When you can launch is determined by appropriate thresholds set specifically for the needs of the Kon-tiki project by Portal Space. If your rocket can launch in different conditions you can alter them by pressing the button under:
Max height is the maximum possible height the rocket can reach. This wil be the maximum height we wil consider when calculating if the rocket can launch or not.
No internet connection, make sure you are connected to the internet and relaunch the app

"Some airspace is restricted to ensure safety and security. Remember to check that your chosen launch site is in legal areas and ask the municipality, landowner, Avinor and the Norwegian Civil Aviation Authority for permission well in advance of launch. "

The National Association of Rocketry provides a safety code for the safe development and use of model rockets. Remember that the larger the rocket, the more important safety measures are. So make a good risk assessment!
Scroll left to see more weather data.\nPinch to zoom.
Max Ground Wind is the maximum wind speed at ground layer for which it is safe to launch the rocket
max wind is the maximum wind speed at any level for which it is safe to launch the rocket
Max Wind Shear is the maximum wind shear at any level for which it is safe to launch the rocket
Max Cloud Fraction is the maximum cloud coverage in % for which it is safe to launch the rocket
Max Fog is the maximum fog fraction in % for which it is safe to launch the rocket
Max allowed rain is the maximum amount of rain in mm/h for which it is safe to launch the rocket
Max humidity is the maximum relative humidity in % for which it is safe to launch the rocket
Max Dew Point is the maximum dew point temperature in â„ƒ for which it is safe to launch the rocket

"Safety margin is how much of the threshold is colored Green and Yellow for each Threshold. For example a Threshold of 10.0 with the Margin set to 0.6 wil be colored green until 6.o, yellow until 10.0 and red for anything above 10 "
